info.title: AI public API
info.description: This API exposes AI metric & event information and associated metadata

get.description: Gets metric values for a single metric

post.description: Gets metric values for multiple metrics

get.description: Gets metadata describing the available metrics
Executes an OData query for events
Gets the data for a single event
Gets OData EDMX metadata describing the event data model
Executes an Analytics query for data

post.description: Executes an Analytics query for data. [Here](/documentation/2-Using-the-API/Query) is an example for using POST with an Analytics query.

get.description: Gets Analytics query schema describing the data model

app-id.name: app-id
app-id.description: ID of the application. This is Application ID from the API Access settings blade in the Azure portal.

metric-id.name: metric-id
metric-id.description: ID of the metric. This is either a standard AI metric, or an application-specific custom metric.

metrics-timespan.name: timespan
metrics-timespan.description: The timespan over which to retrieve metric values. This is an ISO8601 time period value. If timespan is omitted, a default time range of `PT12H` ("last 12 hours") is used. The actual timespan that is queried may be adjusted by the server based. In all cases, the actual time span used for the query is included in the response.

metrics-aggregation.name: aggregation
metrics-aggregation.description: The timespan over which to retrieve metric values. This is an ISO8601 time period value. If timespan is omitted, a default time range of `PT12H` ("last 12 hours") is used. The actual timespan that is queried may be adjusted by the server based. In all cases, the actual time span used for the query is included in the response.

metrics-interval.name: interval
metrics-interval.description: The time interval to use when retrieving metric values. This is an ISO8601 duration. If interval is omitted, the metric value is aggregated across the entire timespan. If interval is supplied, the server may adjust the interval to a more appropriate size based on the timespan used for the query. In all cases, the actual interval used for the query is included in the response.

metrics-segment.name: segment
metrics-segment.description: The name of the dimension to segment the metric values by. This dimension must be applicable to the metric you are retrieving. To segment by more than one dimension at a time, separate them with a comma (,). In this case, the metric data will be segmented in the order the dimensions are listed in the parameter.

metrics-top.name: top
metrics-top.description: The number of segments to return.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

metrics-orderBy.name: orderby
metrics-orderBy.description: The aggregation function and direction to sort the segments by.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

metrics-filter.name: filter
metrics-filter.description: An expression used to filter the results.  This value should be a valid OData filter expression where the keys of each clause should be applicable dimensions for the metric you are retrieving.

event-type.name: event-type
event-type.description: The type of events to query; either a standard event type (`traces`, `customEvents`, `pageViews`, `requests`, `dependencies`, `exceptions`, `availabilityResults`) or `$all` to query across all event types.

events-timespan.name: timespan
events-timespan.description: Optional. The timespan over which to retrieve events. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the Odata expression.

events-filter.name: $filter
events-filter.description: An expression used to filter the returned events

events-search.name: $search
events-search.description: A free-text search expression to match for whether a particular event should be returned

events-orderby.name: $orderby
events-orderby.description: A comma-separated list of properties with \"asc\" (the default) or \"desc\" to control the order of returned events

events-select.name: $select
events-select.description: Limits the properties to just those requested on each returned event

events-skip.name: $skip
events-skip.description: The number of items to skip over before returning events

events-top.name: $top
events-top.description: The number of events to return

events-count.name: $count
events-count.description: Request a count of matching items included with the returned events

events-apply.name: $apply
events-apply.description: An expression used for aggregation over returned events

applications-param.name: applications
applications-param.description: Application IDs to include in cross-application queries.

query-timespan.name: timespan
query-timespan.description: Optional. The timespan over which to query data. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the query expression.

query-param.name: query
query-param.description: The Analytics query. Learn more about the [Analytics query syntax](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/app-insights-analytics-reference/)

query-body.name: body
query-body.description: The Analytics query. Learn more about the [Analytics query syntax](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/app-insights-analytics-reference/)

metric-id.description: ID of the metric. This is either a standard AI metric, or an application-specific custom metric.

metrics-timespan.description: The timespan over which to retrieve metric values. This is an ISO8601 time period value. If timespan is omitted, a default time range of `PT12H` ("last 12 hours") is used. The actual timespan that is queried may be adjusted by the server based. In all cases, the actual time span used for the query is included in the response.

metrics-aggregation.description: The aggregation to use when computing the metric values. To retrieve more than one aggregation at a time, separate them with a comma. If no aggregation is specified, then the default aggregation for the metric is used.

metrics-interval.description: The time interval to use when retrieving metric values. This is an ISO8601 duration. If interval is omitted, the metric value is aggregated across the entire timespan. If interval is supplied, the server may adjust the interval to a more appropriate size based on the timespan used for the query. In all cases, the actual interval used for the query is included in the response.

metrics-segment.description: The name of the dimension to segment the metric values by. This dimension must be applicable to the metric you are retrieving. To segment by more than one dimension at a time, separate them with a comma (,). In this case, the metric data will be segmented in the order the dimensions are listed in the parameter.

metrics-top.description: The number of segments to return.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

metrics-orderBy.description: The aggregation function and direction to sort the segments by.  This value is only valid when segment is specified.

metrics-filter.description: An expression used to filter the results.  This value should be a valid OData filter expression where the keys of each clause should be applicable dimensions for the metric you are retrieving.

id.description: An identifier for this query.  Must be unique within the post body of the request.  This identifier will be the 'id' property of the response object representing this query.

parameters.description: The parameters for a single metrics query

id.description: The specified ID for this metric.

status.description: The HTTP status code of this metric query.

body.description: The results of this metric query.

interval.description: The interval used to segment the metric data.

start.description: Start time of the metric segment (only when an interval was specified).

end.description: Start time of the metric segment (only when an interval was specified).

event-type.description: The type of events to query; either a standard event type (`traces`, `customEvents`, `pageViews`, `requests`, `dependencies`, `exceptions`, `availabilityResults`) or `$all` to query across all event types.

events-timespan.description: Optional. The timespan over which to retrieve events. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the Odata expression.

events-filter.description: An expression used to filter the returned events

events-search.description: A free-text search expression to match for whether a particular event should be returned

events-orderby.description: A comma-separated list of properties with \"asc\" (the default) or \"desc\" to control the order of returned events

events-select.description: Limits the properties to just those requested on each returned event

events-skip.description: The number of items to skip over before returning events

events-top.description: The number of events to return

events-count.description: Request a count of matching items included with the returned events

events-apply.description: An expression used for aggregation over returned events

value.description: Contents of the events query result.

id.description: The unique ID for this event.

name.description: The name of the custom event

duration.description: The duration of the page view

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the page view

totalDuration.description: The total duration of the load

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the load

networkDuration.description: The network duration of the load

sendDuration.description: The send duration of the load

receiveDuration.description: The receive duration of the load

processingDuration.description: The processing duration of the load

name.description: The name of the client performance

success.description: Indicates if the request was successful

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the request

resultCode.description: The result code of the request

success.description: Indicates if the dependency was successful

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the dependency

resultCode.description: The result code of the dependency

severityLevel.description: The severity level of the exception

problemId.description: The problem ID of the exception

handledAt.description: Indicates where the exception was handled at

assembly.description: The assembly which threw the exception

method.description: The method that threw the exception

outerType.description: The outer type of the exception

outerMethod.description: The outer method of the exception

outerAssembly.description: The outer assmebly of the exception

outerMessage.description: The outer message of the exception

innermostType.description: The inner most type of the exception

innermostMessage.description: The inner most message of the exception

innermostMethod.description: The inner most method of the exception

innermostAssembly.description: The inner most assembly of the exception

severityLevel.description: The severity level of the exception detail

outerId.description: The outer ID of the exception detail

message.description: The message of the exception detail

type.description: The type of the exception detail

id.description: The ID of the exception detail

assembly.description: The assembly of the stack entry

method.description: The method of the stack entry

level.description: The level of the stack entry

line.description: The line of the stack entry

name.description: The name of the availability result

success.description: Indicates if the availability result was successful

duration.description: The duration of the availability result

performanceBucket.description: The performance bucket of the availability result

message.description: The message of the availability result

location.description: The location of the availability result

id.description: The ID of the availability result

size.description: The size of the availability result

value.description: The value of the performance counter

name.description: The name of the performance counter

category.description: The category of the performance counter

counter.description: The counter of the performance counter

instanceName.description: The instance name of the performance counter

instance.description: The instance of the performance counter

name.description: The name of the custom metric

value.description: The value of the custom metric

valueSum.description: The sum of the custom metric

valueCount.description: The count of the custom metric

valueMin.description: The minimum value of the custom metric

valueMax.description: The maximum value of the custom metric

valueStdDev.description: The standard deviation of the custom metric

events-operation-info.description: Operation info for an event result

events-session-info.description: Session info for an event result

events-user-info.description: User info for an event result

events-cloud-info.description: Cloud info for an event result

events-ai-info.description: AI related application info for an event result

events-application-info.description: Application info for an event result

events-client-info.description: Client info for an event result

stateOrProvince.description: State or province of the client

countryOrRegion.description: Country or region of the client

query-param.description: The Analytics query. Learn more about the [Analytics query syntax](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/app-insights-analytics-reference/)

query-timespan.description: Optional. The timespan over which to query data. This is an ISO8601 time period value.  This timespan is applied in addition to any that are specified in the query expression.

applications-param.description: Application IDs to include in cross-application queries.

query-results.title: A query response.
query-results.description: Contains the tables, columns & rows resulting from a query.

tables.description: The list of tables, columns and rows.

table.title: A query response table.
table.description: Contains the columns and rows for one table in a query response.

columns.description: The list of columns in this table.

rows.description: The resulting rows from this query.

type.description: The data type of this column.

target.description: Indicates which property in the request is responsible for the error.

value.description: Indicates which value in 'target' is responsible for the error.

resources.description: Indicates resources which were responsible for the error.

error-info.title: The code and message for an error.

innererror.description: Inner error details if they exist.

error-response.title: Error details.
error-response.description: Contains details when the response code indicates an error.
